page.title: 03Beverstone Castle Gatehouse.
page.content: By turning north off the A4135 at grid reference 862937 one can drive up a lane which leads to Beverstone Church.On the left shortly before reaching the church the original gatehouse of Beverstone Castle can still be seen.This was added to the castle during the fourteenth century.The grooves which held the portcullis can still be seen as can the guard rooms which flanked the entrance passage.There are signs of a drawbridge but the double moat which it spanned can now only be seen to the west of the castle.
